title: Former Richmond footy player Todd Elton joins Love Island Australia
text:
Two new islanders are entering Love Island Australia this week, including a former AFL football player.

Todd Elton, 26, played for the Richmond Football Club for six years.

He'll be joined in the villa by Instagram model Blake Williamson, who boasts a whopping 122,000 followers on the social media platform.

Hello: Former Richmond footy star Todd Elton (L) and male Instagram model Blake Williamson (R) are joining Love Island Australia this week

The boys will be replacing ousted 'Bomb Squad' babes, Jordan Cayless and Biannca Rose, who were dumped on Tuesday's episode.

Love Island host Sophie Monk was noticeably absent from Tuesday's elimination, leaving fans of the show baffled.

Instead of waltzing into the villa to deliver the bombshell verdict like in previous episodes, the former Bachelorette's role was replaced by a series of text messages.

Player! Todd, 26, played for the Richmond Football Club in the AFL for six years

And even the show's narrator Eoghan McDermott seemed surprised by Sophie's mysterious disappearance.

As the islanders gathered around the firepit, Eoghan announced his famous phrase, only to be interrupted by Cynthia Taylu shouting: 'I've got a text!'

'Ladies and gentlemen, bring on the Monk,' he began. 'A text? Oh, fair enough. Bring on the text!'

Social: Todd will be joined in the villa by Instagram model Blake, who boasts a whopping 122,000 followers on the social media platform

Cynthia was left to reveal that the 'Bomb Squad' would be broken up as the three intruders faced being evicted.

Cassie Lansdell was the next original girl in line to receive a text, announcing that one of the girls would stay, while two would be sent packing.

Love Island Australia is currently available to stream on 9Now
description: Two new islanders are entering Love Island Australia this week, including a former football player.
